channel.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
channel.description:
I would have gotten a much better render than this. But i cannot manage to get the .mqo into blender. Soo, heres the shitty render.
[IMG]http://i34.tinypic.com/1zlyo78.png[/img]
No i will not be releasing it, it was intended for practice since i have not done any models in a while. Also, it was intended to be like a throwing knife, before you talk about its disign.

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Java Is My Bitch:

You put the impression on me that primitive modeling is bad.

How so? im pro-primitive, meaning i only use primitive technique, and i didnt find any implication that primitive modelling was ‘bad’, hes just saying he doesnt fully understand how to use it to his advantage… also, he TRIED primitive modelling, so hes a beginner… dont compare your work to a begginers, thats like me comparing my work to yours, or like comparing frells work to mine.

Read full topic
item.source: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:24, topic:309581”]I was going for a primitive-based model. Nothing to try and impress someone.[/quote]Tell me what that sounds like because it sounded kinda like what I said. I’m going to get off this topic but you need to shape the primitives so your model doesn’t look like a hole bunch of spheres, because honestly that’s what it looks like.

Also for a throwing knife the handle needs to be as long as the blade itself, so the knife spins amongst it’s center of gravity.

Read full topic

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars


[/quote]Every “primitive based model” I’ve ever done owns your best one.[/quote]

Alright? That doesnt really matter, im not trying to impress anybody. So why are you?

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Eeh, the 1st pic is like i explained. Also, i can round stuff, to an extent, by myself, ive done it before in a previous sword. As of the custom knives, i would endup leaving out the rope, and it throws off the balance. Or at least it has with all i have messed with.

Read full topic
item.source: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

CoonHunter:

I re-quote the part i said “like” rofl. Not a replica, if i wanted to do a throwing knife, it would basically be a 3d/2d box, with an edge. Sorry to admit it, but those would be an easy model to make imo.

not necessarily, thats just saying you wouldnt put time into it to add shape/definition to it… look:
http://www.swordsswords.com/ProductImages/ninja_gear/throwing_knives/Silver_Wings_knife_set_A1303-2.jpg

custom ones:
http://images.google.ca/imgres?imgurl=http://www.trueswords.com/images/prod/c/kit_rae_throwing_knives_540.jpg&imgrefurl=http://www.trueswords.com/black-custom-throwing-knife-p-3836.html&usg=__Psk6r9OVXWs_39geSNbtKM_WM_w=&h=540&w=540&sz=76&hl=en&start=4&um=1&tbnid=U02JYJMtdf09_M:&tbnh=132&tbnw=132&prev=/images%3Fq%3DThrowing%2BKnife%26hl%3Den%26safe%3Doff%26client%3Dfirefox-a%26rls%3Dorg.mozilla:en-US:official%26sa%3DN%26um%3D1

those would be fun to model, and it would make you model without using subsurf, but instead learning to shape the model yourself. being able to round edges without subsurf is a huge advantage over those who use subsurf and cant self-round. and it saves poly too, since subsurf to high levels can kill the program.

Read full topic

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:16, topic:309581”][quote author=badger41 link=topic=406035.msg3002290#msg3002290 date=1256090636]
why is the pummel so big? it makes the hilt look like a door knob imo…
[/quote]

For some reason it acually did that in the render, not sure why. The actual model has a smaller pummel. Also, its supposed to be like a throwing knife anyways, meaning it needs to have even weight on both sides of hilt, for a good throwing center of gravity.[/quote]
But they do that by using a single piece of metal, not 3… the reason the throwing knife is so balanced is cuz the handles the length of the blade, to balance it out, no pummel needed.

Read full topic

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @lost72 lost72
item.description:
@lost72 wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:12, topic:309581”][quote author=lost72 link=topic=406035.msg3002067#msg3002067 date=1256079432]

That’s horrible, I can’t believe you go around criticizing other people’s work.

Who? Dylan? Naa, i actually enjoy it when him, CJ, or JJ give me some tips. Ive been here for a while and they know what i can, and cannot do. So no problem on Dylan’s criticism.

Erm… He meant you.
[/quote]
why would he mean me? id think he was implying coons model was horrible, and he couldnt believe coon could criticize other ppls work. i cant see how he is referring to me[/quote]

I did mean coon, I screwed up my quote, only meant to quote other guys. And theres nothing wrong about criticizing others work, no matter how much better than they are than you.

Read full topic

item.source: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

CoonHunter:

Dylan, i know it wasnt needed. Factor in, i have not made any models in a long time, so i was getting used to the program all-over again. Sorry that its not the best, imo its better than my other blades though.

the subsurf ruined it. it just created unnecessary faces through smoothing, next model you make, dont use any subsurf smooth it yourself, itll benefit you more than subsurfing will, trust me

Read full topic
item.source: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:2, topic:309581”]ehhh nothin great. honestly, why are you all subsurf whores? you shouldnt use subsurf unless its necessary, which, in this case, was not. notice how subsurf made your handle like this
=::::::::= instead of :::::::::::
and your blade

-=:::::::::::::::::::==-
all your doing is creating a flimsy, unrealistic shape and smoothness. that hilt couldnt even support the blade.
i know your trying to learn primitives and all, but subsurfing isnt necessary in alot of cases. i dont subsurf any low poly models and only do so when necessary on high poly ones. it is possible to round things off with looped faces…[/quote]

Dylan, i know it wasnt needed. Factor in, i have not made any models in a long time, so i was getting used to the program all-over again. Sorry that its not the best, imo its better than my other blades though.

Read full topic

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @lost72 lost72
item.description:
@lost72 wrote:

Can’t change it into blender file? Thats easy… Just save your file as a .3ds file and then import it from blender. If you honestly can’t I could render it for you.

Read full topic
item.source: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)

item.title: First model out of Prim's. (fixed pic)
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

ehhh nothin great. honestly, why are you all subsurf whores? you shouldnt use subsurf unless its necessary, which, in this case, was not. notice how subsurf made your handle like this
=::::::::= instead of :::::::::::
and your blade

-=:::::::::::::::::::==-
all your doing is creating a flimsy, unrealistic shape and smoothness. that hilt couldnt even support the blade.
i know your trying to learn primitives and all, but subsurfing isnt necessary in alot of cases. i dont subsurf any low poly models and only do so when necessary on high poly ones. it is possible to round things off with looped faces…

Read full topic
